headline: Nike (NKE) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of athletic apparel brand Nike (NYSE:NKE) fell 2.7% in the morning session after credit rating agency Moody's downgraded several of the company's debt ratings, citing cost pressures and heightened competition. In its report, Moody's noted that factors including tariffs and a more competitive market were expected to result in weaker cash flow and higher leverage for the footwear giant. The rating agency projected that while Nike's profit margins would recover, the process would be slow.

headline: Wall Street Bulls Look Optimistic About Nike (NKE): Should You Buy?
summary: Based on the average brokerage recommendation (ABR), Nike (NKE) should be added to one's portfolio. Wall Street analysts' overly optimistic recommendations cast doubt on the effectiveness of this highly sought-after metric. So, is the stock worth buying?

headline: Loop signs multi-year agreement with Nike for recycled polyester resin
summary: Clean technology company Loop Industries and athletic footwear and apparel major Nike have partnered to advance the use of recycled content across the latter’s product lines.

headline: US Stock Market Today: S&P 500 Futures Slip as Yields Stay Stubbornly High
summary: The Morning Bull - US Market Morning Update Friday, Nov, 14 2025 US stock futures are pointing lower this morning, with S&P 500 contracts down about 0.38 percent and Nasdaq futures sliding nearly 0.7 percent. The biggest catalyst weighing on sentiment is the stubbornly high US 10-year Treasury yield, which remains above 4.1 percent. For everyday investors, that means borrowing costs are still relatively high, and businesses may find it tougher to invest and expand. At the same time, a jump of...

headline: On Stock Doesn’t Have a Tariff Problem After All
summary: THE TRADER   On Holding stock has moved to the back of the pack this year. The next few months could see it sprint into the lead. It’s been a tough year for most sneaker stocks, including Swiss footwear and clothing company On.
